commit.message: chore:enhance the rewrite and add tone feature

files.patch:
@@ -0,0 +1,26 @@
+export const TONES = {
+  pro: `
+Write in a professional, clear, industry-standard tone.
+Concise, factual, and suitable for senior engineers.
+`,
+  devlife: `
+Write like an experienced developer explaining changes to teammates.
+Friendly, casual, but still clear and technical.
+`,
+  fun: `
+Write in a light, playful developer tone.
+Still accurate, but slightly witty.
+`,
+  concise: `
+Write extremely concise.
+No fluff. No emojis. Just the essentials.
+`,
+    detailed: `
+Write in a detailed, explanatory tone.
+Provide context and reasoning behind changes.
+`,
+    optimistic: `
+Write in an optimistic, positive tone.
+Focus on progress and learning, even from challenges.
+`,
+};

@@ -6,8 +6,16 @@ Added documentation updates today ðŸ“˜
 Sometimes small changes like better docs and visuals make a project 10x easier to understand.
 Keeping docs in sync with code is underrated but essential.
 
-Whatâ€™s one thing you document every time?
-`
+What's one thing you document every time?
+`,
+    tech_stack_update: `
+Updated the tech stack mentions in the project ðŸ› ï¸
+
+Being transparent about what powers your project helps others learn and contribute.
+Every line of documentation matters.
+
+Building in public, one commit at a time.
+`,
   },
 
   learning: {
@@ -18,7 +26,7 @@ Promises and async/await look simple until edge cases show up.
 Refactoring with clearer async flows improved readability and error handling.
 
 Still learningâ€”always improving.
-`
+`,
   },
 
   technical_decision: {
@@ -29,8 +37,40 @@ Not all changes are about featuresâ€”some are about making future work safer and
 These decisions rarely show up in demos, but they matter most.
 
 Engineering is about trade-offs.
-`
+`,
+    error_handling: `
+Improved error handling today.
+
+Good error handling is invisible when it works, but saves hours when things break.
+Every try-catch block is a future debugging session prevented.
+
+Defense in depth.
+`,
+    networking: `
+Worked on network calls today.
+
+APIs are great until they're not. Proper error handling, retries, and timeouts matter.
+The difference between a flaky app and a reliable one is how you handle failures.
+
+Resilience by design.
+`,
+    large_change: `
+Big refactor today. 500+ lines changed.
+
+Large changes are risky but sometimes necessary for long-term maintainability.
+Careful testing and incremental commits make big changes manageable.
+
+Progress over perfection.
+`,
   },
-  
 
-};
+  daily_update: {
+    small_win: `
+Made progress today. Every change, big or small, is a step forward.
+
+Celebrating the wins and learning from the challenges. 
+
+#DevLife
+`,
+  },
+};
\ No newline at end of file

commit.message: chore:fix the provider and add GROQ api

files.patch:
@@ -1 +1,5 @@
-GITHUB_TOKEN=your_github_personal_access_token
+# Get your Groq API key from: https://console.groq.com/
+GROQ_API_KEY=gsk_your_key_here
+
+# Get your GitHub token from: https://github.com/settings/tokens
+GITHUB_TOKEN=ghp_your_token_here
\ No newline at end of file

commit.message: chore: update the index.js for ai rewriting and tone
chore: add the ai tone manager

files.patch:
@@ -0,0 +1,24 @@
+export const TONE_PROFILES = {
+    calm_builder:{
+        style : "clear,thoughtful,reflective",
+        emoji: false,
+        sentenceLength:"medium",
+    },
+    excited_learner :{
+        style : "enthusiastic,curious,upbeat",
+        emoji: true,
+        sentenceLength:"short",
+    },
+    senior_engineer:{
+        style : "confident,experienced,insightful",
+        emoji: false,
+        sentenceLength:"medium",
+    },
+    pragmatic_problem_solver:{
+        style : "direct,solution-focused,practical",
+        emoji: false,
+        sentenceLength:"short",
+    }
+
+
+};
\ No newline at end of file

@@ -0,0 +1,36 @@
+export const TEMPLATES = {
+  build_in_public: {
+    documentation_progress: `
+Added documentation updates today ðŸ“˜
+
+Sometimes small changes like better docs and visuals make a project 10x easier to understand.
+Keeping docs in sync with code is underrated but essential.
+
+Whatâ€™s one thing you document every time?
+`
+  },
+
+  learning: {
+    async_patterns: `
+Worked on async handling today.
+
+Promises and async/await look simple until edge cases show up.
+Refactoring with clearer async flows improved readability and error handling.
+
+Still learningâ€”always improving.
+`
+  },
+
+  technical_decision: {
+    engineering_tradeoff: `
+Made a technical change that required careful consideration today.
+
+Not all changes are about featuresâ€”some are about making future work safer and faster.
+These decisions rarely show up in demos, but they matter most.
+
+Engineering is about trade-offs.
+`
+  },
+  
+
+};
